We've just started to realise that on some pages (like venues landing) that image is actually just filler - the content below it is more important to get higher up the page!

Not with that template, the layout cuts divides the page from under 
the log across to the second column, so content *can't* float up.

And hard would it be to remove/change? Lars did it for the Blog landing
page...and lessons learned from that that we could re-use elsewhere?

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

Hi Liz,

We'd need to create a new template similar to the generic content/news one then then move the central content.

The difference is the Games hub doesn't have a blue header either? [and we can't easily add one in due to in needing to span two columns; obv. we could code a brand new layout but non trivial)

http://www.london2012.com/games/venues/index.php
http://www.london2012.com/news/2010/03/links-of-london-appointed-as-the-official-jewellery-coll.php

It would look a bit odd to have a venues hub without a header though no? especially as the venues do have a header?

Obviously if this is what you want we can do it, would probably take a couple to a few hours work depending on exactly what you wanted.

(I think all Lars did was swap you to a new template and make sure that no content was lost in the process, it was made a little bit more complex because the blog template was tightly ties to a master template used by other templates. This should be slightly easier as the template doesn't have hundreds of pages made form it)

Let us know if you are happy with the Venue hub looking like the top of the news page, ie. no blue header or image (obv. with different main content) and if you want us to progress.

Jamie

Hm, maybe I haven't explained myself clearly. We want blue
header...just not the image! Ideally we'd have the *option* of having
no image - so if there was one it'd show but if not, the content moves
up. But that's what you're saying isn't possible?

 

Here's my vision:

 

 

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

No that *exactly* what isn't possible :) The blue header extends across the top two rows, see attached screen shot.

Will get Lars to look at if it is possible to create a brand new template, but it's not as trivial as just dropping the image, as there is a hard break under the logo that extends across both logos. In other words the text *won't* flaot up past the bottom of the logo (ie. it just sits where it is now when the image is removed)

Leave it for now - not worth the effort until we've gotten more feedback!

Hi
Am trying to rename a folder in the CMS from Get Ahead Apprentice Programme to Get Ahead School Leavers'Programme but keep getting an error (see screen grab for details)

Hi Lianne,

It won't let you rename it because reaming nested sections can have unforeseen consequences - basically it changes the url's of all the pages in that folder (and nested folders of) meaning any inbound links  will get broken and possibly a lot of re-publication.

We can do it at the DB level but we'd also need to rename all the sub folders so it's not trivial for us either.

If you haven't created many pages yet it may actually be quicker to start again with a new top level folder and just move the pages into it.

Let me know if your ok doing that?

Jamie

comments.value: Do you recall our database of postcodes / regions which we purchased from the Office of National Statistics to allow us to look up regions on the basis of postcodes? I have someone internally here who would like to use it - do you still have the disk or could you forward me the contents so I can share it with them? Also, do you think we need to purchase an updated version - I know the current one is a couple of years old.

Hi Morag,

The last version we have is Nov 2008 I have put it on the live servers under a password for you.

http://webservices.london2012.com/nspdc_nov_2008_uk_100m_pp.csv.zip 
http://webservices.london2012.com/postcode-lookups.zip 
http://webservices.london2012.com/postcode-namesandcodes.zip 
passwd: locog/l0c0g

I have also attached the user doc to this ticket.

This is the data set you have [UK Core 100m PP DVD]
http://www.statistics.gov.uk/geography/nspd.asp 

Are updates low cost? if so then might be worth getting a new copy to Stamen. But I think for what we use it for your probably OK there is talk of the right to the postcode data being changed shortly as part of the data.gov project so may be worth waiting to see if that happens.Am I right in thinking the ONS data wasn't that expensive (do you mind sharing if you know as I would be interested?)

Nearer to the games I imagine you will almost certainly require an update as all the approach roads to the new site won't be in the old data set. Althogu you (or the ODA) probably have a better idea when that is going to happen!

Jamie

Perfect - thanks so much!

You're right, the ONS data wasn't expensive - I seem to remember it was only £4-5k, though rates vary depending on the type of organisation doing the purchasing (public vs. private).

As you say, we're probably all right to use the data we have for the time being - though an update will be essential when the venues get postcodes too!
